result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre L Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Defendant to Contact the Probation Office 72 Hours following today's proceedings

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA specimen on or before 05-17-2022; pay DNA surcharge. Pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment. Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.
COURT WILL ALLOW FOR EXPUNGEMENT UPON COMPLETION OF PROBATION SENTENCE. EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONDITIONED ON ANY FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS.

- Comply with any recommended treatment or counseling determined by the agent.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.

Defendant Andre L Turner in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. 
Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

 
SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS the House of Correction  with credit for 5 DAYS  time served. 
Court  IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.
    
Pay mandatory cost, fees  and surcharges  during t erm of probation or civil judgment.
Pay all Supervision fees as determined by the DOC during the term of probation or Civil Judgment.
 Provide DNA specimen on or before 5-17-2022  and Pay DNA surcharge
 Restitution set at Zero.    
Comply with  any recommended treatment or counseling determined  by the agent..
Defendant to Contact the Probation Office 72 Hours following today's proceedings
Maintain Absolute sobriety. 
No contact with dangeous weapon.
Court will allow for expungement upon completion of  probation sentence. 
Court Notes: Expungment is not conditioned on any financial obligations. 
Appellate Rights given

AS TO COUNT 2  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
Elements of the Offense/  WIS JI - Criminal

Defendant Andre L Turner in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Andre L Turner in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andre L Turner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
